ygData.subject: Ester Update
ygData.msgSnippet: Nothing really new - but nice to get a response EsterTheTester Station Member   posted 09-05-2000 10:19 PM ... You re right I should have given a response. The
ygData.messageBody:
Nothing really new - but nice to get a response

EsterTheTester
Station Member posted 09-05-2000 10:19 PM
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
----
You're right I should have given a response. The problems with eta's are I
get flamed if we don't meet them.
Most of you have been paitent and curteous (sp??) and I HATE to disappoint.
No we did not have any converstaions about bards today. I spent 90% of my
day going over some new content so it goes in correctly. Now before I get
the 'why are you putting in new content before the old stuff is fixed' let
me share with you that the people who are putting in new content are NOT the
ones who are fixing the old stuff (usually).

However I get to test all of it. I have a wonderful group of testers who
work VERY hard. This is the project we have been working on for almost two
weeks now and there is an end in sight. Next are Bards (not just lulaby) and
then the iksar quests.

Gordon asked me today about bards. I told him I was overworked and I'll get
to it. Guys please bear with me.

I feel like a broken record here. I don't repost because I have nothing new
to say. I'm not looking for any 'poor ester is overworked' nonsence, it's my
job, I LOVE my job, but I can't do everything at once.

GZ is at my disposal as soon as I have things to bring him. He tells me that
every time he sees me in the hallway.

You guys are not nags. You are not whining (well the ones I actually listen
to are not) and I think you have some valid concerns. I have never played a
bard so I have a learning curve here and it is going to take a bit for me to
overcome that.

On another note to a VERY long post, the but with the disapeparing text
buffer (which is one I want fixed!!) are you guys getting it a lot? I am
going to post it's own thread, but we are seeing it mostly with bards...
/sigh

Please know that I am not ignorning or blowing anyone's issues off. These
things take more time than I realized.
